result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetrius S McGee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, restitution  and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Dineka R. or Nyah M.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention Counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and also that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (37 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING commencing JULY 23, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT #1 (CHARGE): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Dineka R. or Nyah M.    
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, restitution and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
   Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* Pay restitution in the amount of $1,604.81 to Dineka R.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.  mld

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
New defense counsel is in receipt of the discovery from prior counsel.  Medical records needed by defense counsel.  New defense counsel does not object to the consolidation of cases 2015CF1835 and 2015CF2116.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-23-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for trial: Cases 2015CF1835 and 2015CF2116 with co-defendant case 2015CF2117.   Defense counsel may address the consolidation of cases in the future, if needed, per the Court.   Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-16-2015 at 8:30 am.   

Attorney Allison Ritter appeared later that same date, and advised that she had been retained by defendant as new counsel.  Attorney Ritter advised of the next court date on 6-16-2015 at 8:30 am for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Dineka R; Co-defendant: Lashaun Taylor.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Demetrius S McGee in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Demetrius S McGee in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
